remarks: A mapping to a scalar product is finitely supported if the mapping to the scalar is finitely supported.  (Contributed by AV, 5-Oct-2019.)
statement:
mptscmfsupp0.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. V ) $.
mptscmfsupp0.q $e |- ( ph -> Q e. LMod ) $.
mptscmfsupp0.r $e |- ( ph -> R = ( Scalar ` Q ) ) $.
mptscmfsupp0.k $e |- K = ( Base ` Q ) $.
mptscmfsupp0.s $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. D ) -> S e. B ) $.
mptscmfsupp0.w $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. D ) -> W e. K ) $.
mptscmfsupp0.0 $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` Q ) $.
mptscmfsupp0.z $e |- Z = ( 0g ` R ) $.
mptscmfsupp0.m $e |- .* = ( .s ` Q ) $.
mptscmfsupp0.f $e |- ( ph -> ( k e. D |-> S ) finSupp Z ) $.
mptscmfsupp0 $p |- ( ph -> ( k e. D |-> ( S .* W ) ) finSupp .0. ) $.
$d .* k $.
$d B k $.
$d D k $.
$d K k $.
$d k ph $.
